body:
I have a problem with `view` in envrionments. I was adding a new package and activating/de-activating my environment. I ended up NOT needing the new package. 
But somewhere environment "remembers" that this package exists, so if I switch branches I try to use the environment without the package being available as a part of Spack I get an error"

```
==> Error: Package 'foo' not found
```

`spack reindex` does not help, I tried to remove the corresponding folder from `.spack-env` inside `spack/var/spack/environments/<bar>/` but this does not solve the issue either.

Right now I can only work with my environment if I disable view: `view: false`.
title: Environments view remembers non-existing / temporary package
